document_data.caption: Lonefang Mountain, far to the north of the Spine of the World.
document_data.name: Lonefang Mountain
document_data.mainbody: '''Lonefang Mountain''', or simply '''Lonefang''', was an exceptionally frigid mountain and, by far, the northernmost named peak in [[northwest Faerûn]].{{Cite interactive atlas}}
document_data.Geography: Lonefang was so far up north that it was isolated from almost all sites of interest, except from the [[Dragonholes]]. This frozen mountain was {{SI|250|mile|k|long=yes}} north of the eastern part of the Spine of the World.
document_data.Defenses:
The frozen lake of the entrance itself served as a point of defense. [[Arauthator]], who dwelt here, was known to cast [[spell]]s at intruders who wished to make it further into the cavernous network.

There were no known guards in this lair.
document_data.History: In the 14{{th}} and 15{{th}} centuries [[DR]], Lonefang was the main home of the [[chaotic evil]] [[white dragon]], Arauthator.
document_data.Rumors & Legends:
Though it only had one visible entrance, this lair was thought to also have an underground back entrance near the [[Worldwyrm's Teeth]]. This back entrance was said to exist several miles to the north and west of the lair and could be accessed via glacial rifts.

According to a victim who escaped Lonefang Mountain, the prison within looked incredibly similar to a gnomish craft that was used to travel to other [[crystal sphere]]s.
document_data.Inhabitants: Arauthator, the Old White Death, made his main lair here. He was known to gleefully laugh as he made his way to the lower-most storage cavern. Once arrived, he would roll around in the bed of gems and purr, much like an excited [[cat]].
